Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Initial Appearance as to Glendaly Rosario-Laboy, Edwin Colon-Diaz held on 5/8/2008. Present were AUSA Jose Capo, AUSA Myriam Fernandez and PTO Shakira Botello. Defendants were provided with copy of the indictments and advised as to their rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 forms filled by defendants, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Each defendant will be represented by a member of the CJA panel of attorneys. Arraignment and Detention hearings set for 5/13/2008 at 09:00 AM before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive. Defendants are ordered detained pending hearings. (yr) (Entered: 05/12/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas:Arraignment as to Jose A. Feliciano-Maldonado (12) Count 1,2,3,4,6 held on 5/13/2008. AUSA Myriam Fernandez and AFPD Rafael Andrade were present. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defendant remains under custody. Defense is granted five (5) days to meet with the U. S. Attorney to obtain discovery and ten (10) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, CI: Marie Hernandez) (br) (Entered: 05/13/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas:Bail Hearing as to Jose A. Feliciano-Maldonado held on 5/13/2008. AUSA Myriam Fernandez and AFPD Rafael Andrade were present. Defense counsel had no evidence. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, CI: Marie Hernandez, PO: Guillermo Montanez) (br) (Entered: 05/13/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Detention Hearing as to Glendaly Rosario-Laboy held on 5/13/2008. Present were AUSA Jose Capo, AUSA Myriam Fernandez, Mr. Juan Matos De Juan, PTO Wendy Moreno and court interpreter Felix Toledo. Arguments heard by the parties as to bail for this defendant. The Government called to the witness stand Agent Reinaldo Sanabria- Colon, DEA Task Force agent in Ponce. Direct and cross-examination of witness conducted. After hearing the testimony of the witness and the arguments from the parties, the Court did not adopt the recommendation made by PT and ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR.) (yr) (Entered: 05/13/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas:Detention Hearing as to Gilbert Ramirez-Torres held on 7/15/2008. AUSA Myriam Fernandez and AUSA Jose Capo and defense counsel Rosa Bonini were present. The parties were heard by proffer. The Government suggest a bond of $20,000 cash or secured. Defense counsel proffered that defendant's mother has a house that was appraised at $10,000 and that defendant voluntarily surrendered in Pennsylvania and was placed on an unsecured bond. He was instructed in Pennsylvania to report to Puerto Rico on 7/11/08 for which he did. After hearing the parties, the Court set bond as to Gilbert Ramirez-Torres (10) in the amount of $50,000 (20% in cash or secured and remainder unsecured). Standard release conditions imposed, submit to urinalysis, remain employed, receive drug treatment, may travel from Puerto Rico to Eastern District of Pennsylvania and vice versa for court proceedings only. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, CI: Edna Brayfield, PO: Evelyn Jimenez) (br) (Entered: 07/15/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: DeNovo Hearing as to Glendaly Rosario-Laboy held on 12/2/2008. Parties proceed by proffer. Defense requests bail recommendation within the PTS-Report be adopted. Defendant's relatives are present, and has available two properties to post bail. Defense counsel also argues that the defendant is in need of medical treatment. Arguments in opposition are heard on behalf of the government. Makes an extensive proffer as to the defendant's role in the conspiracy and the evidence they have against the defendant. Requests detention. After hearing the parties, the Court finds that the defendant poses a danger to the community and the request for bail is DENIED. No written opinion will follow, Court's findings are on the record. Court will look into defendant's medical condition, though, it's noted that no medical certificate has been provided. (Court Reporter Yvette Richardson.)(Court Interpreter Felix Toledo.)Hearing set for 3:00 p.m. Hearing held at

28 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:01 p.m. (sr) Present: AUSA Jose Capo, defense counsel Juan Matos de Juan, defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Eddebbie Cofresi and Wallace Bustelo. Interpreter Juan Llagostera also present for the government. (Entered: 12/03/2008)

ORDER settling 266 Motion to Suppress as to Antonio De-Jesus-Velazquez (7) Suppression Hearing set for 4/23/2009 09:00 AM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive.The Court has referred to this Magistrate Judge defendant Antonio De Jesus-Velazquez' motion to suppress. However, defendant De Jesus-Velzquez is apprised he should first need to establish standing as to the marihuana that was allegedly seized from a box and another individual in an open area near the motor vehicle where said defendant was located. Insofar as probable cause for the arrest, defendant De Jesus-Velazquez submits he was arrested first and then the evidence was seized, raising lack of probable cause for the arrest. Whether such action could be considered a Terry-stop or an arrest by state agents back on July 14, 2006, and how it 1s related to the federal arrest in the conspiracy charged on April 29, 2008, and/or it is but an overt act of the conspiracy, will need to be clarified at the onset of the hearing. Unless the defendant crosses this threshold, the suppression hearing will not prosper. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive on 4/1/2009. (IM) (Entered: 04/01/2009)

ORDER as to Antonio De-Jesus-Velazquez The suppression hearing before Magistrate Judge Velez-Rive scheduled for 4-23-2009 is vacated and set aside. Counsel for defendant De Jesus-Velazquez is to make a showing, in writing, by April 13, 2009, as to the threshold requisites at Docket No.

that is, (1) standing to seek suppression of the evidence referred to as marihuana that was allegedly seized from a box and another individual in an open area near the motor vehicle where said defendant was located and (2) probable cause for the arrest on claims that defendant De Jesus- Velazquez was arrested first and then the evidence was seized. Counsel is to address in this motion how such arrest by state agents back on July 14, 2006, is related to the probable cause for the federal arrest in the conspiracy charged on April 29, 2008 of this federal indictment. No extension of time will be granted since the case is already scheduled for trial before the presiding judge. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive on 4/3/2009.(IM) (Entered: 04/03/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Motion Hearing as to Glendaly Rosario-Laboy held on 6/5/2009 re 489 Emergency MOTION for Hearing For Re-opening of the Hearing. Upon inquiry of the Court, the defendant states that she doesn't wish to continue with her legal representation. The Court grants the request and attorney Matos de Juan is withdrawn from the case. The Court appoints attorney Esther Castro as new counsel. Government informs that even though attorney Castro represents co-defendant Miguel Negron-Santiago, he does foresee any conflict of interest at this moment. (Defendant entered a plea of guilty, is pending sentence). Court orders attorney Matos to provide all discovery and Jencks material to attorney Castro. (It's noted that the CDs were provided to her today in court). Attorney Castro is granted until 7/10/09 to: assess the case, inform if there's a need to withdraw the plea or the need for a setting just to clarify and reinstate the plea already taken on the record. Counsel is to file motion accordingly. Court will consider referring case to a Magistrate Judge, for a Foster Hearing, once counsel has filed the motion. Defendant is instructed to cooperate with counsel. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)(Court Interpreter Felix Toledo.) Hearing set for 3:00 p.m. Hearing held at 4:30 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:45 p.m. (sr)Present: AUSA Jose Capo & Myriam Fernandez. Defense counsel Juan Matos de Juan. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Jose Figueroa. Court appointed counsel Esther Castro-Schmidt also present. (Entered: 06/08/2009)
INFORMATIVE motion on Providing the Case File to New Counsel by Glendaly Rosario-Laboy. (Matos-De-Juan, Juan) (Entered: 06/08/2009)

ORDER as to Antonio De-Jesus-Velazquez re 577 MOTION to Vacate MOTION to Reduce Sentence MOTION to Substitute Attorney filed by Antonio De-Jesus- Velazquez. Defendant, Pro-Se, appears to challenge the use of guideline Section 2D1.1 for his conviction on violations of T. 21 Sections 841, 846 and 860 rather than guideline Section 2D1.2 which is applicable for those convicted of "attempted or conspiracy to unlawfully possess". Defendant is mistaken inasmuch as he was convicted for participating in a conspiracy which objective was the illegal possession with intent to  distribute. More so, defendant was sentenced to the mandatory statutory minimum pursuant to the plea agreement which was the sentence defendant stipulated to and that was requested from the Court pursuant to the sentencing memorandum at Docket No. 547. The existence of a mandatory minimum moot any departure possibilities under 5K2.0. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 9/11/2009.(wm) (Entered: 09/11/2009)
